metadata.title: CVE-2020-1749 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's implementation of some networkingprotocols in IPsec, such as VXLAN and GENEVE tunnels over IPv6. When anencrypted tunnel is created between two hosts, the kernel isn't correctlyrouting tunneled data over the encrypted link; rather sending the dataunencrypted. This would allow anyone in between the two endpoints to readthe traffic unencrypted. The main threat from this vulnerability is to dataconfidentiality.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-1749` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-106-generic - 4.15.0-106.107
linux-image-4.15.0-106-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-106.107
linux-image-4.15.0-106-lowlatency - 4.15.0-106.107
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-106-generic - 4.15.0-106.107
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-106-lowlatency - 4.15.0-106.107
No subscription required

linux-image-5.3.0-40-generic - 5.3.0-40.32~18.04.1
